Abstract: Pentecostal movement, which was born in Los Angeles in 1906, has caught on among half a billion people and is likely to continue growing in next century because it is well suited to a world of continual change, of immigration and refugees, of people adrift and yearing for a bit of respect and a sign of hope from God; photos (M)
Snippet: Pentecostal movement, which was born in Los Angeles in 1906, has caught on among half a billion people and is likely to continue growing in next century because it is well suited to a world of continual change, of immigration and refugees, of peop...
LeadParagraph: THE Pentecostal movement was born in Los Angeles in 1906 on forlorn Azusa Street, inside an abandoned church previously used as a stable and still reeking of horses. Led by a half-blind black preacher from Louisiana named William J. Seymour, a band of whites, blacks and Hispanics defied the strictures of segregated worship, gathered together and prayed for a sign from the Holy Spirit.

Headline.Main: A Direct Line to God In an Impersonal Era
Headline.PrintHeadline: VISIONS: IDENTITY; A Direct Line to God In an Impersonal Era
